description: This Slow Cooker Apple Cider Glazed Ham is the perfect centerpiece for any holiday gathering. The sweet and tangy glaze infuses the ham with rich flavors, making every bite a delightful experience that will impress your guests.
instructions: Place the ham in the slow cooker, cut side down.
In a bowl, mix apple cider, brown sugar, Dijon mustard, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg.
Pour the glaze over the ham, cover, and cook on low for 6-8 hours, basting occasionally.
tips: For a perfectly glazed ham, make sure to baste it with the cooking liquid every hour for maximum flavor.

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this ham for a family holiday dinner. The aroma filled the house, and everyone gathered around the table, eager to dig in. It quickly became a cherished tradition.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Begin by placing the ham in the slow cooker, ensuring it fits snugly. Mix the glaze ingredients in a bowl until well combined.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Cover the slow cooker and set it to low. Cook for 6-8 hours, basting the ham every hour to keep it moist and flavorful.
Finishing Touches:
Once the ham is heated through and glazed, remove it from the slow cooker and let it rest for 15 minutes before slicing.

upload.context: The slow cooker in action with the ham and glaze cooking together.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cooking the ham low and slow ensures it remains juicy and tender.
  • Avoid overcooking; check the internal temperature to ensure it reaches 140Â°F.
  • Look for a caramelized glaze as a sign that it's ready to serve.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

structured_content.content: Sharing this dish with family during the holidays brings back fond memories of laughter and togetherness. It's a dish that truly embodies the spirit of celebration.
For an extra kick, try adding a splash of bourbon to the glaze or incorporating fresh herbs like rosemary for a unique twist.
This ham pairs beautifully with roasted vegetables, mashed potatoes, or a fresh green salad. Serve with a glass of apple cider or a light white wine for a complete meal.
For a gluten-free option, ensure your mustard is gluten-free. You can also substitute the ham with a turkey breast for a lighter alternative.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Score the surface of the ham before glazing for better flavor absorption.
  • Let the ham rest before slicing to keep it juicy.
  • Use a meat thermometer to check for doneness without cutting into the ham.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an elegant presentation.
